column4: where exactly can i get the ms core fonts package for ubuntu ?
Package msttcorefonts is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source
i have no idea what that means
what in the world does that error mean
it seems that debian is still as beligerently unfriendly as ever
what in the world does "referred to by another package" mean
you probably need the universe repository too
if you still have a Windows partition, you can copy Windows's *.ttf fonts to a ~/.fonts directory and they will Just Work (and look better than the old corefonts)
though occasionally the -security universe repository gets security fixes so you might want to leave that.
apt-cache show build-essential or running apt-get will reveal that it's a meta package that downloads much more than just the compiler.
